taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek taxis , order, and thele , nipple, alluding to single row of papillae over cell lumina]

bio:treatment.description: Plants small, yellow-green, somewhat glossy. Stems 1–10 cm, complanate-foliate, irregularly to regularly pinnate. Leaves spreading to appressed, narrowly to broadly ovate to ovate-lanceolate; margins entire or weakly to sharply toothed; apex short-acuminate; ecostate or costa double; alar cells rounded-rhomboid, enlarged or weakly inflated, pigmented, walls thin, without proximal row of inflated, elongate cells, middle lamella not apparent, supra-alar cells differentiated; laminal cells rhomboid to linear, 1-seriate multipapillose. Sexual condition autoicous. Seta 1.5 cm. Capsule inclined to horizontal, ovoid; exothecial cell walls not or weakly collenchymatous; operculum conic, short- or long-rostrate.
bio:treatment.discussion: Taxithelium occurs mainly in forests, generally as corticolous on tree trunks and branches, but also on logs, occasionally on rock and soil.

references.reference: Dumanhuri, A. and R. E. Longton. 1996. Towards a revision of the moss genus Taxithelium (Sematophyllaceae). Anales Inst. Biol. Univ. Nac. Autón. México, Bot. 67: 35–58.
